Multiple images and news stories from lo: 2. The creator of the display, Angela Nava, was interviewed by Houston's KTRK-TV where she discussed her inspiration for the display and the positive response it received from the community.
Pictures posted on Nava: s Facebook page showcased the humorous elements of the display, including a skeleton bouncer and neon-haired skeleton strippers.
The homeowner: s association (HOA) sent Nava a letter requesting the removal of the display, indicating that it was deemed inappropriate for a family neighborhood. However, Nava decided to keep the display up until after Halloween due to the overwhelmingly positive feedback it received.
